net.sourceforge.waters.model.compiler.efa

Class EFAModuleContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sourceforge.waters.model.compiler.context.ModuleBindingContext
      • net.sourceforge.waters.model.compiler.efa.EFAModuleContext
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    BindingContext, VariableContext

    public class EFAModuleContext
extends ModuleBindingContext
implements VariableContext
    The binding context used by the EFA compiler. In addition to bindings of enumeration atoms, the EFA module context includes a symbol table with all variables maintained by the EFA compiler and their range. These are the variables that occur in guards and represent the current state of EFA components such as variables (VariableComponentProxy) or automata SimpleComponentProxy). The symbol table maps expressions (SimpleExpressionProxy) representing variable names to variable objects (EFAVariable) containing the the computed range of its state space. The table contains entries for the current and the next state of each variable.
    Author:
    Robi Malik
    See Also:
    EFACompiler

    • Method Detail

      • getVariableRange

        public CompiledRange getVariableRange(SimpleExpressionProxy varname)
        Description copied from interface: VariableContext
        Gets the range associated with the given variable.
        Specified by:
        getVariableRange in interface VariableContext
        Parameters:
        varname - An expression representing the name of the variable to be looked up. It can be identifier, simple or indexed, (to support array lookups), or a unary expression (to support next-state values of EFA variables).
        Returns:
        The evaluated range determined for the variable with the given name, or null if the name is not associated with any variable, or the range has not yet been determined.

      • getNumberOfVariables

        public int getNumberOfVariables()
        Description copied from interface: VariableContext
        Gets the total number of EFA variables in this context.
        Specified by:
        getNumberOfVariables in interface VariableContext
        Returns:
        The number of current-state variables, not also including next-state variables.
